Bellefull Food Ordering App

The Belleful Food Ordering App API provides a seamless experience for customers to order their favorite meals. This API offers endpoints for managing user accounts, browsing available meals, placing orders, and tracking delivery status.
More information: https://helloreverb.com
Contact Info: contact@bellefull.app
Version: 1.0.0
BasePath:/v1
Apache 2.0
https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html

Access

Methods

Admin

Up 
get /admin/users
Get all users (adminUsersGet)
Retrieve a list of all users registered with the Bellefull Food Ordering App

Return type

array[User]

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
[ {
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}, {
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
} ]

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

List of users retrieved successfully
Up 
delete /admin/users/{userId}
Delete a user (adminUsersUserIdDelete)
Delete a specific user account

Path parameters

userId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the user to delete

Responses

204

User deleted successfully

404

User not found
Up 
get /admin/users/{userId}
Get user details (adminUsersUserIdGet)
Retrieve details of a specific user

Path parameters

userId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the user to retrieve

Return type

User

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

User details retrieved successfully User

404

User not found

  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""

Cart

Up 
get /cart
Get shopping cart (cartGet)
Retrieve the current shopping cart of the authenticated user

Return type

Cart

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Shopping cart retrieved successfully Cart
Up 
delete /cart/{itemId}
Remove item from cart (cartItemIdDelete)
Remove a specific item from the shopping cart

Path parameters

itemId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the item in the cart to remove

Responses

204

Item removed from cart successfully

404

Item not found in cart
Up 
put /cart/{itemId}
Update cart item (cartItemIdPut)
Update details of a specific item in the shopping cart

Path parameters

itemId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the item in the cart to update

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body CartItem (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

Cart

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Cart item updated successfully Cart

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

404

Item not found in cart
Up 
post /cart
Add item to cart (cartPost)
Add a new item to the shopping cart

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body CartItem (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

Cart

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Item added to cart successfully Cart

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

body User (required)
Body Parameter —

  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",

  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}

Meals

Up 
get /meals
Get all meals (mealsGet)
Retrieve a list of all available meals from vendors

Return type

array[Meal]

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
[ {
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "price" : 0.8008282,
  "vendor_id" : "vendor_id",
  "name" : "name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id"
}, {
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "price" : 0.8008282,
  "vendor_id" : "vendor_id",
  "name" : "name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id"
} ]

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

List of meals retrieved successfully
Up 
delete /meals/{mealId}

Path Parameter — ID of the meal to delete

Onboarding

Up 
post /auth/login
Authenticate a user (authLoginPost)
Authenticate a user with the Bellefull Food Ordering App

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Credentials (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

Token

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "accessToken" : "accessToken",
  "refreshToken" : "refreshToken"
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

User authenticated successfully Token

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

401

Unauthorized
Up 
post /auth/recover-password
Recover user password (authRecoverPasswordPost)
Send a password recovery email to the user

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Email (required)
Body Parameter —

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Password recovery email sent

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

404

User not found
Up 
post /auth/signup

  • application/json

Request body

body User (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

User

  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

User registration successful User

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

409

User already exists

Orders

Up 
get /orders
Get all orders (ordersGet)
Retrieve a list of all orders placed by the authenticated user

Return type

array[Order]

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
[ {
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ],
  "status" : "pending"
}, {
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ],
  "status" : "pending"
} ]

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

List of orders retrieved successfully
Up 
delete /orders/{orderId}
Cancel an order (ordersOrderIdDelete)

Path parameters

orderId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the order to cancel

Responses

204

Order canceled successfully

404

Order not found

  } ],

404

Order not found
Up 
put /orders/{orderId}
Update order status (ordersOrderIdPut)
Update the status of a specific order

Path parameters

orderId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the order to update

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Order (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

Order

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ],
  "status" : "pending"
}

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Order status updated successfully Order

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

404

Order not found
Up 
post /orders
Place a new order (ordersPost)
Place a new order with the selected items in the shopping cart

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Order (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

Order

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "user_id" : "user_id",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "items" : [ {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  }, {
    "quantity" : 0,
    "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
    "id" : "id",
    "meal_id" : "meal_id"
  } ],
  "status" : "pending"
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Order placed successfully Order

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

Payments

Up 
post /payments
Process payment (paymentsPost)
Process payment for a specific order

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Payment (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

Receipt

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "amount" : 0.8008282,
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "order_id" : "order_id",
  "payment_date" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00"
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Payment processed successfully Receipt

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

Vendor

Up 
get /vendors
Get all vendors (vendorsGet)
Retrieve a list of all vendors registered with the Bellefull Food Ordering App

Return type

array[User]

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
[ {
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}, {
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
} ]

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

List of vendors retrieved successfully
Up 
post /vendors
Create a new vendor (vendorsPost)
Register a new vendor account with the Bellefull Food Ordering App

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body User (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

User

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Vendor registration successful User

400

Invalid request body InvalidRequest

409

Vendor already exists
Up 
delete /vendors/{vendorId}
Delete a vendor (vendorsVendorIdDelete)
Delete a specific vendor account

Path parameters

vendorId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the vendor to delete

Responses

204

Vendor deleted successfully

404

Vendor not found
Up 
get /vendors/{vendorId}

Path parameters

vendorId (required)
Path Parameter — ID of the vendor to retrieve

Return type

User

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "password" : "password",
  "full_name" : "full_name",
  "role" : "customer",
  "updated_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "bussiness_name" : "bussiness_name",
  "description" : "description",
  "created_at" : "2000-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00",
  "id" : "id",
  "email" : ""
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Vendor details retrieved successfully User

404

Vendor not found
